posts.post_content:
Its banned because you might not be playing a particular card type. If you run no artifacts, no creatures, and no enchantments. Its a one sided board wipe for 2 mana.  
  
Realistically you can play this in a burn deck. Don't play any permanents and drop a whole hand of burn spells. Then make your opponent lose everything and discard his whole hand.  
  
The worst this card can be is 2 mana removal. If it even kills one thing, you got your mana's worth.

Posted By: BattleFish (5/29/2011 1:13:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Just had my first experience against balance. While I was having trouble breaking through thanks to Land Tax + Sylvan Library ensuring he had almost as much card advantage as me, I was well and truly ahead and whittling him away. One balance, and the tables turned - while it didn't seem like he'd be able to break through against me either, my library was 10 cards thinner, meaning that if the game stayed as it was I was going to mill out first.  
  
Fortunately he didn't fancy his chances against an Archon of Justice under a Mimic Vat with a sac outlet out, so he GG'd the turn after. Still, in the right deck Balance would be anything but.

Posted By: kiseki (7/19/2012 4:41:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Looking at Library of Alexandria, Time Vault, and other candidates for 'P10', I think this one actually is the better choice-  
  
Library is just +1 card or +1 mana a turn, which actually sounds like something that, stapled with the right drawback, ought to appear on a new land someday. the Jayemdae Tome knockoffs just aren't good enough and an artifact drawing permanent is actually more splashable than a land with a good drawback- plus a 'pretend Library' would just be sweet to see attempted.   
  
Time Vault was just something doing something uncostable- there's no right way to make a Time Vault that isn't broken in Modern through Vintage.  
  
Balance is a card doing an effect that actually is pretty close to something that OUGHT to be on a card-- just NOT at this mana cost, not NEARLY at this mana cost- so it is very reminiscent of Ancestral Recall and Time Walk in that regard, and thus why I think it's the True P10th :)
posts.html:

Time Vault was just something doing something uncostable- there's no right way to make a Time Vault that isn't broken in Modern through Vintage.

Balance is a card doing an effect that actually is pretty close to something that OUGHT to be on a card-- just NOT at this mana cost, not NEARLY at this mana cost- so it is very reminiscent of Ancestral Recall and Time Walk in that regard, and thus why I think it's the True P10th :)

posts.post_content:
Balance is basically [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) + [Mind Twist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Twist) + [Stone Rain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stone Rain) for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol), when used immaculately.  
  
Back when this was legal to play, it regularly gave me ten-to-one card advantage. I'd sacrifice all my critters to something like [Ashnod's Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashnod's Altar), tap out to play a couple big noncreature spells (dumping the Altar mana into a [Disintigrate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disintigrate) type ![Variable Colorless](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=X&type=symbol) spell when possible), and then "imbalance with balance."  
  
This card might actually be more broken than [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus), and if it hadn't been reprinted a few times, I'm willing to bet we'd be talking about the "power ten" instead of the "power nine."
posts.html:
Balance is basically Wrath of God + Mind Twist + Stone Rain for , when used immaculately.

Back when this was legal to play, it regularly gave me ten-to-one card advantage. I'd sacrifice all my critters to something like Ashnod's Altar, tap out to play a couple big noncreature spells (dumping the Altar mana into a Disintigrate type spell when possible), and then "imbalance with balance."

This card might actually be more broken than Black Lotus, and if it hadn't been reprinted a few times, I'm willing to bet we'd be talking about the "power ten" instead of the "power nine."
